algoSelect.description: Specifies which algorithm to run in preview state: AECConvSlowConv or AECConvFastConv. Slow is recommeded for smooth video capture and Fast for preview

fastConv.description: Fast algorithm converges by measuring the delta to exposure target and adjusting to take into account system delay.

tolMultUnitStepSize.description: Exposure index tolerance is tolMultUnitStepSize * unitStepSize; exposure index range within which AEC will not adjust

frameSkipMethod.description: Specifies which type of frame skip is desired: SmoothNoSkip for smooth convergence, SkipOne if there are synchronization concerns, SkipSystemLatency if speed is preferred to smoothness

aggressiveness.description: Controls convergence speed; 0.0 is slowest and 1.0 is fastest

enableBrightDarkSpeedAdj.description: Enable adjusting convergence speed when there are saturated regions

darkRatioAdjStrength.description: Strength of speed adjustment when there are dark clipped regions

brightRatioAdjStrength.description: Strength of speed adjustment when there are dark clipped regions

thresDarkExpIndexDelta.description: When image is dark and absolute index target delta is larger than this absolute threshold we will adjust convergence speed

thresBrightExpIndexDelta.description: When image is bright and absolute index target delta is larger than this absolute threshold we will adjust convergence speed

ADRCConvSpeed.description: Convergence speed for short and long exposures. Smaller value yields slower convergence.

slowConv.description: Slow algorithm converges smoothly by using exposure index steps the size of which increases or decreases gracefully at the expense of convergence speed

tolMultUnitStepSize.description: Exposure index tolerance is tolMultUnitStepSize * unitStepSize; exposure index range within which AEC will not adjust

frameSkipMethod.description: Specifies which type of frame skip is desired: SmoothNoSkip for smooth convergence, SkipOne if there are sync issues. Slow convergence does not implement SkipSystemLatency

stepFactorWhenFrameSkipEnabled.description: Increase in step size when skip is enabled

convSpeed.description: Controls convergence speed; larger value will result in larger step sizes and therefore faster convergence

refFrameRate.description: Reference frame rate at which the tuning settings were computed

stepRegular.description: Range of step sizes for slow convergence when there are no dark or bright regions. Final step size is interpolated based on convSpeed parameter

stepDark.description: Range of step sizes for slow convergence when exposure is too dark and there are dark regions. Final step size is interpolated based on convSpeed parameter

stepBright.description: Range of step sizes for slow convergence when exposure is too bright and there are bright regions. Final step size is interpolated based on convSpeed parameter

thresSlowDownAbsExpIndexDeltaDark.description: Range of absolute exposure delta from target whithin which algorithm step size will be decreased to smoothly converge to target. Large value means slower approach. Final step size is interpolated based on convSpeed parameter

thresSlowDownAbsExpIndexDeltaBright.description: Range of absolute exposure delta from target whithin which algorithm step size will be decreased to smoothly converge to target. Large value means slower approach. Final step size is interpolated based on convSpeed parameter

maxRawStepAdj.description: Slow convergence algorithm is designed to maintain the same convergence speed, regardless of skip and frame rate. To that effect, the step size is adjusted by a factor. Parameter maxRawStepAdj controls the range of that factor: [1/maxRawStepAdj, maxRawStepAdj]

tolExpIndexDeltaForceAdj.description: If computed step size is zero we will force it to unitStepSize when absolute delta from target is larger than this threshold

thresNumBrightRgn.description: The minimal ratio of bright regions required for bright step size to be used during convergence

thresNumDarkRgn.description: The minimal ratio of dark regions required for dark step size to be used during convergence

holdTimeTuning.description: These parameters control how long the algorithm will hold off adjusting in the presence of stats changes

enableHoldTime.description: Enable holding off exposure adjustments when motion and exposure changes are small

thresAbsExpDelta.description: Range within which hold time is adjusted based on exposure deviation from target. Below this range: hold time is adjusted by expDeltaBasedHTAdjFactor.start; above this range hold time is adjusted by expDeltaBasedHTAdjFactor.end

expDeltaBasedHTAdjFactor.description: Exposure-based hold time adjustment factor range, start needs to be larger than end!

tolAdjFactor.description: Hold time is not allowed if exposure index absolute delta from target is larger than tolerance times this threshold

holdTimeEnterDelay.description: The amount of time AEC needs to be stable before holding time gets activated

maxHoldTime.description: Maximum amount of time AEC will hold off exposure adjustments when large disturbance is measured

enableGyroBasedHT.description: Enable using gyro to determine amount of disturbance

thresGyroMagnitude.description: Range within which hold time is adjusted based on gyro magnitude. Amount of adjustment is controlled by gyroBasedHTAdjFactor

gyroBasedHTAdjFactor.description: Gyro-based hold time adjustment factor range, start needs to be larger than end!

ADRCConvSpeed.description: Convergence speed for short and long exposures. Smaller value yields slower convergence.

enableConvergeGainFirst.description: Speeds up dark to bright convergence by increasing gain first
